channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Metro Manila GCQ extended until June 30; Cebu City put on ECQ
item.description: Duterte himself earlier warned the public that a return to ECQ was in the realm of possibility should the rate of infection speed up.

item.title: Lenders urged to help borrowers get through pandemic
item.description: Sen. Bong Go has again appealed to banks and other financial institutions to provide restructuring programs for corporate and individual borrowers amid uncertainties due to the coronavirus disease pandemic.

item.title: DOST wants local pharmas to make COVID vaccine
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The Department of Science and Technology wants local pharmaceutical companies to manufacture any coronavirus disease 2019 vaccines that may be developed by Chinese or Taiwanese drug makers.

item.title: Former lawmaker appointed TESDA deputy chief
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: President Duterte has appointed former party-list congressman John Bertiz III, who used to represent the interests of the country’s 10 million overseas Filipino workers, as deputy director-general of the Technical Education and Skills Development Authority.

item.title: Establishments to report on closures, retrenchments
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Starting today, all commercial establishments intending to stop operations or retrench workers are required to immediately notify the Department of Labor and Employment.

item.title: Oil price hike today
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Motorists will have to pay more for gasoline and diesel today.

item.title: DepEd introduces dropbox enrollment
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The Department of Education has added a dropbox mode of enrollment starting today as it pushes to get more learners to sign up for school year 2020-2021 amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Ambassadors to present credentials via telecon
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Even a long-time tradition of diplomats was not spared by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Online sellers told: DTI registration only for regulation
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Existing and prospective online sellers need not worry about registering with the Department of Trade and Industry (DTI) as the requirement would only be for regulatory purposes, a lawmaker said yesterday.

item.title: 1.63 million Filipinos tested for COVID by July – DOH
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health is aiming to test some 1.63 million Filipinos for coronavirus disease 2019 by the end of July using the real time-polymerase chain reaction test, an official said yesterday.
